quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Clip
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, eagles, dreamboat. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This artist released his fifth album, The Stranger, in 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Joel

questions.question: On which of the following albums can you find The Eagles song Those Shoes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Long Run

questions.question: Most self-respecting headbangers would not consider this group a metal band. Many of their hits like Sour Girl, Big Empty, Interstate Love Song, and Vasoline seem too poppy to be called metal, but the band had a heavy side demonstrated in songs like Wicked Garden and Sex Type Thing [sound clip].
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stone Temple Pilots

questions.question: Paul McCartney and his band mates (The Beatles)  founded a record label in 1968. What was the name of the record label?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apple

questions.question: Down with the Sickness and Stupify [sound clip] have become alt-metal hits for this Chicago-based band. They have performed on the Ozzfest tour, and their music has been on numerous soundtracks including Saw III, Queen of the Damned, House of Wax, and Little Nicky.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Disturbed

questions.question: This bands hugely successful 1995 single Hey Man, Nice Shot [sound clip] was considered controversial due to the fact that many thought it was about the suicide of Kurt Cobain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Filter

questions.question: In 1976, this band released two albums: Rock and Roll Over and Destroyer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kiss

questions.question: This artist/group released Off the Wall in 1979.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jackson

questions.question: Who performed the song Long Cool Woman (In A Black Dress) in 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hollies

questions.question: Two ex-members of Nirvana (Dave Grohl and Pat Smear) formed this band which produced hits like: This Is a Call, Everlong, Learn to Fly, Best of You, and Ill Stick Around [sound clip].
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Foo Fighters

questions.question: The song heard in the audio clip is from this mega-successul soundtrack from the 1970s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saturday Night Fever

questions.question: This group released the album Dreamboat Annie in 1976.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart

questions.question: Just as Black Sabbath had done thirty years earlier, this artist brought a horror sensibility to rock. His songs include Dragula, More Human Than Human, and Thunder Kiss 65 [sound clip].
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rob Zombie

questions.question: A track on this 1973 album contains the lyrics: Grab that cash with both hands and make a stash. New car, caviar, four star daydream, think Ill buy me a football team.

options.text: The Dark Side of the Moon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dark Side of the Moon

questions.question: Named after a C. S. Lewis novel, this alternative rock band is the first Australian band to have 5 number 1 albums in Australia. Notable songs include: Israels Son, Tomorrow [sound clip], and Freak.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silverchair

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keyboards

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Idiot

questions.question: It is rumored that the actor who portrayed Jim Morrison in the 1991 film The Doors, insisted that:

options.text: People on set refer to him only as Jim.
Each day begin with Tai Chi exercises.
A helicopter be on standby to take him shopping, should the need arise!
Beluga Caviar be available to every cast and crew member

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: People on set refer to him only as Jim.

questions.question: When the musics over, Jim Morisson instructs us to:

options.text: Head on home (with a designated driver, of course!)
Turn down the gain on the microphone!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turn out the lights!

questions.question: What color dress was the devil wearing in Mitch Ryder  The Detroit Wheels 1966 song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: blue

questions.question: The song Man in Black was written and performed by what country star in 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Cash

questions.question: Nancy Sinatra originally performed the song These Boots Are Made For Walkin  in 1966.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Complete this phrase form the Doors song, When the musics over.  For music is your:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Special friend

questions.question: Jim Morrison is alive and performing in a power pop band, doing mall openings in Hamtramck, Michigan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who recorded Itsy Bitsy Teenie Weenie Yellow Polka Dot Bikini in 1960?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bryan Hyland

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schumann

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: St. Willie is one of Green Days songs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sibelius

questions.question: The opera Aida by Giuseppe Verdi was first performed at which great historical event?

options.text: The opening of the Suez Canal
The victory of Ellington at Waterlooo

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The opening of the Suez Canal

questions.question: How many saxophones are there in a symphony orchestra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None

questions.question: In a symphony orchestra, there are more stringed instruments than any other type.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Schuberts Unfinished Symphony was his last known symphony.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Wake me up when November Ends is not a song by Green Day.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gallileo

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1,039 Smoothed Out Slappy Hours

questions.question: Haydns Farewell Symphony was designed as a protest piece over the way musicians were being treated.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The great opera about  Spain, Carmen, was written in which language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: French
